item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #609 (Incorporate CSS changes from Kubrick 1.2.6 into CVS Kubrick) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The Kubrick theme in CVS is based on Ryan Boren's port to WordPress (then) 1.3, originally from Kubrick 1.2.5. Since that port was made, Michael Heilemann released Kubrick 1.2.6, which included some improvements in the CSS file. He lists them as:

# Internet Explorer 5.5 Fix: wp-layout.css - body - text-align: center; # Internet Explorer 5.5 Fix: wp-layout.css - #page - text-align: left;

The attached diff illustrates the three minor changes made to Kubrick's CSS file since Ryan's port. They only affect IE 5.5 users.

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) updated
item.dc:creator: jminard
item.description:
Status, Resolution changed

from wp-includes/functions.php:

trackback - reply function trackback_response($error = 0, $error_message = ) {

if ($error) {

echo '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?'.">\n"; echo "<response>\n"; echo "<error>1</error>\n"; echo "<message>$error_message</message>\n"; echo "</response>";

} else {

echo '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?'.">\n"; echo "<response>\n"; echo "<error>0</error>\n"; echo "</response>";

} die();

}

I can pretty clearly see that this function calls "die()" no matter what you pass it.

Thus, it calls die() and do_action() never happens.

I just checked the download from 1.2.2 and both sections of code have not changed, so this is still an issue.

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) closed
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
70:

The die() command only ever gets executed when trackback_response() is called with a first parameter that is not 0. So if functions in the trackback_post hook does not get executed, then it is either a problem with one of the functions, or a problem with WP's API. But either way, it's not a problem with the order of these lines.

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) updated
item.dc:creator: jminard
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #605 (wp-trackback.php breaks API 'trackback_post' action functionality) created
item.dc:creator: jminard
item.description:
In the file wp-trackback.php at line 88 and 89 it reads:

trackback_response(0); do_action('trackback_post', $comment_ID);

but the function trackback_response() calls a die() in it, thus the trackback_post actions are never applied.

Solution: Flip the two lines. All better.
